item.title: Tutte-Berge Theorem
item.description: Given a graph $ G = (V,E) $, for vertex-matching $M \subseteq E$, the following equality holds \[ \max_{ \textrm{matching } M} |M| = \min_{U \subseteq V}\frac{|U| + |V| - odd\left( G[V \setminus U] \right)}{2} \] where $odd(G)$ is the number of odd-vertexed connected components of the graph $G$. The non-unique $U$ satisfying the equality is called the Tutte witness. This formula gives us an exact size of the max matching in a general graph $G$.
